intro: Senecio belbeysius, commonly known as the Belbeys' groundsel, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are usually narrow and grass-like, while its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in clusters. It is a perennial species that is often found in mountainous regions with well-drained soils.
